quest.name: Ruby Seas under Ruby Skies
journal: J'olhmyn is more than ready to set to tracking Nhaza'a Jaab across the sea.

You speak with J'olhmyn, who has little patience for delays─particularly those that come in the form of M'zhet. She dashes off toward the Ruby Price almost the instant you suggest it as a likely spot to find eyewitnesses, leaving him struggling to keep up.

You meet with J'olhmyn and M'zhet, the latter of whom seems to have recovered his senses, if not his good sense. As time is of the essence, the former suggests that the three of you split up to more efficiently speak with those manning the Ruby Price and search for any other clues that may be present in the vicinity.

Though you speak with several people zealously undertaking their duties at the Ruby Price, they assure you that no one matching Nhaza'a Jaab's description has passed through the area. Disappointing though the result may be, it at least narrows the range of potential routes he may have taken across the Ruby Sea.

Midway through reporting the results─or notable lack thereof─of your investigation to J'olhmyn, you hear M'zhet's scream ring through the salty air. Rushing to its source, you find him being menaced by none other than Kabuto, who has evidently mistaken him for the man who stole Tsukumo─or rather, the materia that once was the kami's soul─right from the Kojin's helmet. Thankfully, your presence causes him to realize his error sooner rather than later, and the initial misunderstanding is soon forgotten. As it appears that the one who purloined Tsukumo and Alpa's kidnapper are one and the same, Kabuto eagerly joins you in your continued search for Nhaza'a Jaab.
On Kabuto's recommendation, you make your way to the fishing village of Isari, again in search of eyewitnesses. Perhaps your inquiries will bear more fruit this time around.

Upon questioning, one of the villagers claims to have seen a man with the characteristics you describe. Though he was apparently not accompanied by a mermaid, given the rarity of Miqo'te in the Far East and the man in question's peculiar fashion sense, it is all but certain that Nhaza'a Jaab indeed passed through Isari, and thereafter headed for either the Azim Steppe or Yanxia. Though the other fisherfolk can provide you with no additional information as to the villain's whereabouts, one man does mention a curious legend of potential note─that of the Three Wonders. According to the fisherman, these mythical treasures─which include the flesh of a mermaid─have been the subject of much gossip of late, as a certain noble lady has made their provision a requirement of those who would claim her hand in marriage.

As you discuss your findings with your companions, Kabuto reveals that he is familiar with folklore regarding the Three Wonders, and that, in addition to Merflesh, the Jewel of Fair Souls and the Philosopher's Fin are counted among their number. He and J'olhmyn theorize that, due to Alpa's oft-remarked-upon resemblance to a mermaid of Far Eastern legend and Tsukumo's rare nature, it may be possible to pass them off as two of the three treasures to a gullible recipient. What Nhaza'a Jaab's ultimate goal in doing so might be remains shrouded in mystery, but if he is indeed collecting counterfeits of the Wonders, it is imperative that Alpa be rescued before her flesh can be separated from her person.
objectives: Speak with J'olhmyn at the Ruby Price.
Speak with potential eyewitnesses at the Ruby Price.
Speak with potential eyewitnesses in Isari.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Grrr... Just wait till I get my hands on that Nhaza'a Jaab! At least we have some idea where he's heading with Alpa, thanks to M'zhet.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I've decided to reward him by not pushing him into the sea, even though he's making it so very tempting. More importantly, where do you reckon we should start our search?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: They likely passed by the Ruby Price? Well, what are we waiting for?

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: J'olhmyn!? Where are you going?

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: (“Just compliment her like a normal person”? It's my first time seeing her wear anything but armor! What do you want from me?)

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Right. Now that we're here, let's split up and ask whether anyone has seen a masked Miqo'te and a “mermaid” about.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: An excellent plan! Aaah, it's nice to have everything back to normal.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: This had better not be about my attire again... If you hadn't noticed, Alpa has been kidnapped by a masked maniac, so go find some eyewitnesses before I change my mind about drowning you!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: I never did get to tell her that her swimsuit was fetching, but at least I managed not to make a fool of myself!

dialogue.name: GUARDA03162
dialogue.text: Keep your distance─we wouldn't want you carelessly firing the cannon. Only I get to do that.

dialogue.name: GUARDB03162
dialogue.text: Nothing to report! At least not to you─I don't even know you.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Finding Alpa is my first priority! What, can't you tell?

dialogue.name: GUARDA03162
dialogue.text: A man wearing a sinister mask?

dialogue.name: GUARDA03162
dialogue.text: He certainly hasn't passed through here. I would know─I've been looking for suspicious persons to fire at all daynightmorning.

dialogue.name: GUARDB03162
dialogue.text: A suspicious man with a...mermaid?

dialogue.name: GUARDB03162
dialogue.text: Hahaha, very funny! You Westerners and your jokes...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Let me know if you learn anything. Unlike some people, locating Alpa is my only concern right now.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: This is infuriating! No sign of any boats captained by brutish Miqo'te, nor whispers of one having passed by previously. Now I see why J'olhmyn is so annoyed!

dialogue.name: GUARDA03162
dialogue.text: Still no sign of your masked man...

dialogue.name: GUARDA03162
dialogue.text: But if he does pass through here, you can be certain that I'll blast him without hesitation!

dialogue.name: GUARDB03162
dialogue.text: Mermaids again?

dialogue.name: GUARDB03162
dialogue.text: Hahaha, it's even funnier the second time! But seriously, get out of my sight or I'll hurl you into the ocean.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Any luck?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: You too, huh? It seems we've hit a dead end here. I haven't the slightest idea what to do now, though...

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Waaauuugh!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: What has he gotten himself into this time? Come on, Forename!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: What is the meaning of this!? First you burst out of the water like some sort of sea monster, and now you threaten me with a blade? I don't even know who you are! Or what you are!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: You know not what you stole from me, but you shall come to regret it! Tsukumo is more precious than any treasure. Return him at once!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Help me, Forename! I'm being beset by this...er, turtle? Man? Turtle man!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Forename!? What an odd coincidence.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Or not a coincidence at all, since you two seem to know each other. In which case, you have my apologies. I should not have drawn my blade without preamble.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it! As the future leader of the M tribe, I was not at all alarmed by your sudden, menacing advance. Not in the least!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: I'm M'zhet Tia, by the way. And any friend of Forename's is a friend of mine!

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I am honored to meet you. My name is Kabuto, and I lead the Blue's Divine Circle.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: The name's J'olhmyn─I'm with the Velodyna Gatekeepers in Ala Mhigo. Can I ask why you were on the point of skewering M'zhet?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Ah. In my haste, I unfortunately mistook him for a thief who recently snatched Tsukumo from my helmet.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: What, precisely, is this “Tsukumo”? You seem rather keen on getting it back.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Tsukumo is my dearest companion and guide, who once walked beside me as a karakuri puppet blessed with a soul. He is now present only as materia, but continues to watch over me.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Wait, wasn't Nhaza'a holding something that looked an awful lot like materia when we saw him at the hot springs? Could that have been Tsukumo?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: If so, it would mean that he robbed Kabuto before kidnapping Alpa─and that we almost certainly won't find him on the Ruby Sea.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: But why not?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: If it were me, I wouldn't want to risk my prize being retaken by its rightful owner─and fending Kabuto off would be a sight more difficult with Alpa in tow. I'd put money on Nhaza'a having made for land as quickly as possible.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: A reasonable conclusion. Assuming he was headed for Othard, the most direct route would have taken him through the village of Isari.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: To Isari we go, then! We'll follow your lead, Kabuto.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: What a charming little fishing village. Would that we were here for some relaxing sightseeing.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: But we have a villain to catch and a captain to save, so let's get to it! Meet me back here once you've gathered as much information as you can.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: I must retrieve Tsukumo at all costs.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: How to best explain the situation... Perhaps I should start with Alpa. So, Alpa is an Ananta─wait, so an Ananta is a sort of person, like a mermaid, but not really...

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERA03162
dialogue.text: A masked man carrying a mermaid? Frankly, I'm not even sure I could imagine such a sight, and I certainly haven't witnessed it.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERA03162
dialogue.text: I did see a man with a curious mask, though. He made landfall in a small boat, and I assume departed on foot soon thereafter, as I haven't seen him since. I'd wager that he made for the Azim Steppe or Yanxia, like most who pass through here.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERB03162
dialogue.text: A suspicious man, and a mermaid with 'im?

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERB03162
dialogue.text: No, there ain't many suspicious sorts coming 'round our little village. And you'll pardon me for sayin' so, but it don't seem likely that a mermaid would keep such company.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: Hmm... I haven't seen your mystery man, but I can tell you that mermaids have been a subject of some discussion around here as of late.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: You see, local legend has it that somewhere out there, far from the sight and grasp of the ordinary man, are what we Hingans call the “Three Wonders,” mermaid's flesh being one. It is said to grant life eternal, be that for better or for worse.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: A few moons past, a young lady born to one of Kugane's oldest─and wealthiest─families proclaimed that, should any gentleman presume to ask for her hand in marriage, she would accept nothing less than all Three Wonders as a dowry.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: It's a fool's errand, certain enough─we Hingans love our faerie stories as well as any folk, but we know the Three Wonders are no more than fantasy. You have to admire her clever ploy to remain unwed, though, which is why it's the talk of the land.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: We need to cast a wide net, so let's spread out and speak to everyone. Make sure to really grill the local fishermen.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Now that we're all back, let's share what we've learned. Hopefully between the four of us we'll have heard enough to go on.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Hmm, so though Nhaza'a was indeed sighted, no one can confirm which direction he departed in. And, if your source is correct, Alpa is no longer with him. Did he stash her somewhere before landing in Isari? And where is he now?

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: The Three Wonders may provide a clue. According to folklore, the treasures are Merflesh, the Jewel of Fair Souls, and the Philosopher's Fin.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I shudder to think of the young lady being forced to marry Nhaza'a of all people, but based on his thefts so far, it does seem like he is collecting the Wonders─or treasures with passing similarity to them, at least.

dialogue.name: KABUTO
dialogue.text: Indeed. If Tsukumo is his substitute for the Jewel of Fair Souls, and your Alpa is meant to be the source of Merflesh, that leaves only one.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: “Flesh” certainly implies a level of dismemberment that I'm not comfortable with. We have to stop him!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Yes, I realize that! If you have any brilliant ideas as to how, now's the time─we can't allow him to stay one step ahead of us.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERA03162
dialogue.text: Assuming your masked man is the same one I saw, he likely headed for the Azim Steppe or Yanxia.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERA03162
dialogue.text: I wish he'd had the mermaid with him, too─that must have been a sight to see!

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERB03162
dialogue.text: Nope, I ain't never in my life seen a man like the one in your tale. Sounds right unsavory.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERB03162
dialogue.text: An' the thought of a mermaid bein' with him is downright unbelievable! They ain't about to hang around with riffraff.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: Hm? Oh, the young lady?

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: I hear she is a maiden of extraordinary beauty, born into wealth and power. And if the tales of her setting her suitors to such an impossible task are true, she's sharp as they come, as well.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: It makes no difference, though. The Three Wonders are the stuff of legend, and legend alone, so none will have her hand, no matter how they pine.

dialogue.name: ISARIVILLAGERC03162
dialogue.text: So don't get any ideas, you hear?
